info.title: SignRequest API
info.description: SignRequest is a secure and legally binding e-signature tool that enables you and your partners to sign contracts and other documents fast and without the hassle of having to print, sign and scan.

post.description: Creates and sends a new SignRequest.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: A page number within the paginated result set.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Triggers when the document status of a SignRequest changes.

file.title: Document Attachment File
file.description: Temporary URL to document attachment, expires in five minutes

file_from_content_name.title: Document Attachment File From Content Name
file_from_content_name.description: Filename, including extension. Required when using `file_from_content`.

file_from_url.title: Document Attachment File From Url
file_from_url.description: Publicly accessible URL of document to be downloaded by SignRequest

needs_to_sign.title: Signer Needs To Sign
needs_to_sign.description: When `false` user does not need to sign, but will receive a copy of the signed document and signing log, see: [Copy only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Copy-only)

approve_only.title: Signer Approve Only
approve_only.description: Require user to approve the document (without adding a signature), see: [Approve only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Approve-only)

notify_only.title: Signer Notify Only
notify_only.description: Send notifications about the document and a copy of the signed document and signing log, but don't require them to take any action, see: [Notify only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Notify-only)

in_person.title: Signer In Person
in_person.description: When used in combination with an embed url on the sender, after sender has signed, they will be redirected to the next `in_person` signer, see: [In person signing](#section/Additional-signing-methods/In-person-signing)

use_stamp_for_approve_only.title: Signer Use Stamp For Approve Only
use_stamp_for_approve_only.description: Place an approval stamp on a document when a signer approves a document

password.title: Signer Password
password.description: Require the signer to enter this password before signing a document. This field is write only.

from_email.title: Signrequest From Email
from_email.description: Email of user sending the SignRequest (must be a validated email)

from_email_name.title: Signrequest From Email Name
from_email_name.description: Name to be used in the `From` email header, e.g. `{from_email_name} <no-reply@signrequest.com>`

is_being_prepared.title: Signrequest Is Being Prepared
is_being_prepared.description: Have the sender of a SignRequest prepare the document before sending the request out, see: [prepare using the web interface](#section/Preparing-a-document/Prepare-using-the-web-interface)

redirect_url.title: Signrequest Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is signed

redirect_url_declined.title: Signrequest Redirect Url Declined
redirect_url_declined.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is declined

disable_text_signatures.title: Signrequest Disable Text Signatures
disable_text_signatures.description: Disable usage of signatures generated by typing (text)

disable_emails.title: Signrequest Disable Emails
disable_emails.description: Disable all SignRequest status emails as well as the email that contains the signed documents

disable_blockchain_proof.title: Signrequest Disable Blockchain Proof
disable_blockchain_proof.description: Disables storing timestamp proof hashes in blockchain integrations.

text_message_verification_locked.title: Signrequest Text Message Verification Locked
text_message_verification_locked.description: When true a text message verification is needed before the signer can see the document

message.title: Signrequest Message
message.description: Message to include in SignRequest email, may contain the following html tags: `a`, `abbr`, `acronym`, `b`, `blockquote`, `code`, `em`, `i`, `ul`, `li`, `ol`, and `strong`

who.title: Signrequest Who
who.description: `m`: only me, `mo`: me and others, `o`: only others

send_reminders.title: Signrequest Send Reminders
send_reminders.description: Automatically remind signers to sign a document, see: [automatic reminders](#section/Working-with-a-SignRequest/Automatic-reminders)

pdf.title: Signing Log Pdf
pdf.description: Temporary URL to signing log, expires in five minutes

file_as_pdf.title: Document File As Pdf
file_as_pdf.description: Temporary URL to original file as PDF, expires in five minutes

external_id.title: Document External Id
external_id.description: ID used to reference document in external system

frontend_id.title: Document Frontend Id
frontend_id.description: Shared secret used in conjunction with SignRequest-js client to grant user access to a document that's not a member of the document's team

file.title: Document File
file.description: Temporary URL to original file, expires in five minutes

file_from_url.title: Document File From Url
file_from_url.description: Publicly accessible URL of document to be downloaded by SignRequest

events_callback_url.title: Document Events Callback Url
events_callback_url.description: URL at which to receive [event callbacks](#section/Events/Events-callback) for this document

file_from_content_name.title: Document File From Content Name
file_from_content_name.description: Filename, including extension. Required when using `file_from_content`.

auto_delete_days.title: Document Auto Delete Days
auto_delete_days.description: Number of days after which a finished document (signed/cancelled/declined) will be automatically deleted

auto_expire_days.title: Document Auto Expire Days
auto_expire_days.description: Number of days after which a non finished document will be automatically expired

pdf.title: Document Pdf
pdf.description: Temporary URL to signed document as PDF, expires in five minutes

status.title: Document Status
status.description: `co`: converting, `ne`: new, `se`: sent, `vi`: viewed, `si`: signed, `do`: downloaded, `sd`: signed and downloaded, `ca`: cancelled, `de`: declined, `ec`: error converting, `es`: error sending, `xp`: expired

from_email.title: Signrequest From Email
from_email.description: Email of user sending the SignRequest (must be a validated email)

from_email_name.title: Signrequest From Email Name
from_email_name.description: Name to be used in the `From` email header, e.g. `{from_email_name} <no-reply@signrequest.com>`

is_being_prepared.title: Signrequest Is Being Prepared
is_being_prepared.description: Have the sender of a SignRequest prepare the document before sending the request out, see: [prepare using the web interface](#section/Preparing-a-document/Prepare-using-the-web-interface)

redirect_url.title: Signrequest Redirect Url
redirect_url.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is signed

redirect_url_declined.title: Signrequest Redirect Url Declined
redirect_url_declined.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is declined

disable_text_signatures.title: Signrequest Disable Text Signatures
disable_text_signatures.description: Disable usage of signatures generated by typing (text)

disable_emails.title: Signrequest Disable Emails
disable_emails.description: Disable all SignRequest status emails as well as the email that contains the signed documents

disable_blockchain_proof.title: Signrequest Disable Blockchain Proof
disable_blockchain_proof.description: Disables storing timestamp proof hashes in blockchain integrations.

text_message_verification_locked.title: Signrequest Text Message Verification Locked
text_message_verification_locked.description: When true a text message verification is needed before the signer can see the document

message.title: Signrequest Message
message.description: Message to include in SignRequest email, may contain the following html tags: `a`, `abbr`, `acronym`, `b`, `blockquote`, `code`, `em`, `i`, `ul`, `li`, `ol`, and `strong`

who.title: Signrequest Who
who.description: `m`: only me, `mo`: me and others, `o`: only others

send_reminders.title: Signrequest Send Reminders
send_reminders.description: Automatically remind signers to sign a document, see: [automatic reminders](#section/Working-with-a-SignRequest/Automatic-reminders)

api_used.title: Document Api Used
api_used.description: Indicates whether document was created using the API

pdf.title: Signing Log Pdf
pdf.description: Temporary URL to signing log, expires in five minutes

auto_delete_after.title: Document Auto Delete After
auto_delete_after.description: Date and time calculated using `auto_delete_days` after which a finished document (signed/cancelled/declined) will be automatically deleted

sandbox.title: Document Sandbox
sandbox.description: Indicates whether document was created as part of a sandbox team

auto_expire_after.title: Document Auto Expire After
auto_expire_after.description: Date and time calculated using `auto_expire_days` after which a non finished document will be automatically expired

processing.title: Document Processing
processing.description: Indicates whether a change to the document is processing and the PDF may be out of date. It is recommended to wait until processing has finished before downloading the PDF. Webhooks are not sent until processing has been completed.

file_from_url.title: File from url
file_from_url.description: Publicly accessible URL of document to be downloaded by SignRequest

file_from_content_name.title: File from content name
file_from_content_name.description: Filename, including extension. Required when using `file_from_content`.

from_email.title: From email
from_email.description: Email of user sending the SignRequest (must be a validated email)

from_email_name.title: From email name
from_email_name.description: Name to be used in the `From` email header, e.g. `{from_email_name} <no-reply@signrequest.com>`

is_being_prepared.title: Is being prepared
is_being_prepared.description: Have the sender of a SignRequest prepare the document before sending the request out, see: [prepare using the web interface](#section/Preparing-a-document/Prepare-using-the-web-interface)

redirect_url.title: Redirect url
redirect_url.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is signed

redirect_url_declined.title: Redirect url declined
redirect_url_declined.description: URL at which SignRequest will redirect to when a document is declined

required_attachments.description: Attachments that signers are required to upload

disable_text_signatures.title: Disable text signatures
disable_text_signatures.description: Disable usage of signatures generated by typing (text)

disable_emails.title: Disable emails
disable_emails.description: Disable all SignRequest status emails as well as the email that contains the signed documents

disable_blockchain_proof.title: Disable blockchain proof
disable_blockchain_proof.description: Disables storing timestamp proof hashes in blockchain integrations.

text_message_verification_locked.title: Text message verification locked
text_message_verification_locked.description: When true a text message verification is needed before the signer can see the document

message.title: Message
message.description: Message to include in SignRequest email, may contain the following html tags: `a`, `abbr`, `acronym`, `b`, `blockquote`, `code`, `em`, `i`, `ul`, `li`, `ol`, and `strong`

who.title: Who
who.description: `m`: only me, `mo`: me and others, `o`: only others

send_reminders.title: Send reminders
send_reminders.description: Automatically remind signers to sign a document, see: [automatic reminders](#section/Working-with-a-SignRequest/Automatic-reminders)

external_id.title: External id
external_id.description: ID used to reference document in external system

frontend_id.title: Frontend id
frontend_id.description: Shared secret used in conjunction with SignRequest-js client to grant user access to a document that's not a member of the document's team

file.title: File
file.description: Temporary URL to original file, expires in five minutes

events_callback_url.title: Events callback url
events_callback_url.description: URL at which to receive [event callbacks](#section/Events/Events-callback) for this document

auto_delete_days.title: Auto delete days
auto_delete_days.description: Number of days after which a finished document (signed/cancelled/declined) will be automatically deleted

auto_expire_days.title: Auto expire days
auto_expire_days.description: Number of days after which a non finished document will be automatically expired

delete_after.title: Delete after
delete_after.description: When filled this team will be deleted after this date

sandbox.title: Sandbox
sandbox.description: Indicates whether team is in Sandbox mode

needs_to_sign.title: Needs to sign
needs_to_sign.description: When `false` user does not need to sign, but will receive a copy of the signed document and signing log, see: [Copy only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Copy-only)

approve_only.title: Approve only
approve_only.description: Require user to approve the document (without adding a signature), see: [Approve only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Approve-only)

notify_only.title: Notify only
notify_only.description: Send notifications about the document and a copy of the signed document and signing log, but don't require them to take any action, see: [Notify only](#section/Additional-signing-methods/Notify-only)

in_person.title: In person
in_person.description: When used in combination with an embed url on the sender, after sender has signed, they will be redirected to the next `in_person` signer, see: [In person signing](#section/Additional-signing-methods/In-person-signing)

who.title: Who
who.description: `m`: only me, `mo`: me and others, `o`: only others

name.title: Name
name.description: Optional name to easily identify what webhook is used for
